title: These Boston restaurants should have been on NYT best of lists, according to readers

bullets: Readers Say From neighborhood staples to hidden gems, here’s what readers thought The New York Times missed.

title: 2 plead guilty to hate crime charges after attacking trans employee at Mass. liquor store
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime The employee and her fiancé were seriously injured in the attack.
Two men were sentenced Monday after pleading guilty to hate crime charges in relation to assaulting a transgender employee and her fiancé at a Western Mass.
liquor store in 2024.

title: Police respond to pro-Palestine encampment at BU
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News Demonstrators briefly occupied an area near a BU student center before dispersing on Monday night.
The Boston University campus.

Blake Nissen for The Boston Globe, File Police officers responded to the campus of Boston University Monday, dispersing a group of pro-Palestine demonstrators attempting to set up an encampment there.

title: Paul Pierce identifies mindset that Jaylen Brown can’t afford to have playing without Jayson Tatum
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Boston Celtics "He can’t have the mindset like, I’ve got to go in and score more points because we’re losing points in Tatum.
" Jaylen Brown Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff For the first time since his rookie season in 2017, Jaylen Brown will face the prospect of playing without Jayson Tatum for an extended period of time.
Tatum came in and started 80 games as a 19-year-old rookie 2018 and hasn’t missed more than 18 games in a season during his eight year career.
